item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Lisa Schroeder
item.description:
"I write a note and tape it to my window--
I'M NOT A DETECTIVE. BE SPECIFIC!" -- Lisa Schroeder

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Christopher Farnsworth
item.description: "Right. Just let the nice monster turn him into paste." -- Christopher Farnsworth

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Love sucks. Sometimes it feels good. Sometimes it's just another way to bleed." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Maybe they know what I know, that the true way to a man's heart is six inches of metal between his ribs. Sometimes four inches will do the job, but to be really sure, I like to have six." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "There comes a point when you either embrace who and what you are, or condemn yourself to be miserable all your days. Other people will try to make you miserable; don't help them by doing the job yourself." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "I talk to myself everyone once in a while. Give myself very good advice. Sometimes I even take it." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Lindsay Faith Rech
item.description: "Why save the rainforest, the whales, or the world when you can devote your time to saving syllables?" -- Lindsay Faith Rech

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Cassandra Clare
CorLostForWords add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "If you were half as funny as you think you are, you'd be twice as funny as you are now." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Do you remember back at the hotel when you promised that if we lived, you’d get dressed up in a nurse’s outfit and give me a sponge bath?" asked Jace. "It was Simon who promised you the sponge bath." "As soon as I’m back on my feet, handsome," said Simon. "I knew we should have left you a rat." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Sarcasm is the last refuge of the imaginatively bankrupt." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green." "If there was such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood," said Jace." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "I felt like I had just double-tapped Santa." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "People have far more power than they realize, if they would only choose to use it." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Kimberley Griffiths Little
item.description: "And Mamma was still asleep. I called it the sleeping sickness because coma is the ugliest word in the entire universe. If I could, I'd erase it from the dictionary, but Old Webster would probably hunt me down." -- Kimberley Griffiths Little

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Eleanor Brown
item.description: "She remembered one of her boyfriends asking, offhandedly, how many books she read in a year. "A few hundred," she said. "How do you have the time?" he asked, gobsmacked. She narrowed her eyes and considered the array of potential answers in front of her. Because I don't spend hours flipping through cable complaining there's nothing on? Because my entire Sunday is not eaten up with pre-game, in-game, and post-game talking heads? Because I do not spend every night drinking overpriced beer and engaging in dick-swinging contests with the other financirati? Because when I am waiting in line, at the gym, on the train, eating lunch, I am not complaining about the wait/staring into space/admiring myself in reflective surfaces? I am reading! "I don't know," she said, shrugging." -- Eleanor Brown

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Tahereh Mafi
item.description: "we write every day, we fight every day, we think and scheme and dream a little dream every day. manuscripts pile up in the kitchen sink, run-on sentences dangle around our necks. we plant purple prose in our gardens and snip the adverbs only to thread them in our hair. we write with no guarantees, no certainties, no promises of what might come and we do it anyway. this is who we are." -- Tahereh Mafi

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Katie Kacvinsky
item.description: "Live a little," she tells me. "You're never going to experience anything if you wait around for perfect conditions." -- Katie Kacvinsky

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Katie Kacvinsky
item.description: "In my baggy jeans and messy hair, I know I don't fit into this plastic palace. But I don't want to fit in. That's when no one notices you. You leave a longer impression when you're brave enough to stand out." -- Katie Kacvinsky

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Katie Kacvinsky
item.description: "I don’t know much, but this is what I’ve learned. You’ll fall for the last person you ever thought you’d be interested in. That’s the tricky part. You might not even notice her at first. And she usually comes around just when you’ve stopped looking. But if you pay attention, you’ll know it’s her because she’ll stand out from everybody else. She might even scare you. But if you’re lucky enough to meet this girl, be smart enough to realize it and try not to screw it up." -- Katie Kacvinsky

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Katie Kacvinsky
item.description: "But pain's like water. It finds a way to push through any seal. There's no way to stop it. Sometimes you have to let yourself sink inside of it before you can learn how to swim to the surface." -- Katie Kacvinsky

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Michelle Hodkin
item.description: "I was warned about you, you know." And with that half-smile that wrecked me, Noah said, "But you're here anyway." -- Michelle Hodkin

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "For last year's words belong to last year's language And next year's words await another voice." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: CorLostForWords add a quote by John Grisham
item.description: "In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard." -- John Grisham
